result.execSummary:
The defendant Eliazar Realzola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eliazar Realzola

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eliazar Realzola in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 4 - 
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
ON COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served. Huber to apply for work and treatment.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months. 

ON COUNT 4: Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served. Huber to apply for work and treatment.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months.

Court orders the sentences on Counts 1 and 4 to run CONCURRENT to one another. 

WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:

- Serve 2 WEEKS condition time with Huber for work and treatment, IMPOSED AND STAYED, to be used at the discretion of the Agent. 
- No fine due to inability to pay. 
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
- Random UA's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- No contact with Why Not Bar or ESP.
- Attend an in person firearms safety course. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant may possess a firearm while attending firearms safety course. 
- Submit a DNA sample by 6/24/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Court waives all non-mandatory costs. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.


AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, AND 5  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea

Defendant Eliazar Realzola in court with attorney Jason Findling for Jade K Hall.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Findling requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Eliazar Realzola in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Hall requests one more status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Eliazar Realzola in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  
Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Defense is investigating the possibility of a DPA resolution and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ESP AND YNOT Bar (708 E. Layton Ave).   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eliazar Realzola in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Eliazar Realzola in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
